properties.areaDesc: Southeast Utah; Animas River Basin; Grand and Battlement Mesas; Eastern Uinta Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Upper Gunnison River Valley; Uncompahgre Plateau/Dallas Divide; Canyonlands/Natural Bridges; Central Yampa River Basin; Debeque to Silt Corridor; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus; San Juan River Basin; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Four Corners/Upper Dolores River; Gore and Elk Mountains/Central Mountain Valleys; Upper Yampa River Basin; Eastern Uinta Mountains; Lower Yampa River Basin; Arches/Grand Flat; Grand Valley; La Sal and Abajo Mountains; Flat Tops; Tavaputs Plateau; Central Colorado River Basin; Paradox Valley/Lower Dolores River; Northwestern San Juan Mountains
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 31 at 2:56PM MST by NWS Grand Junction CO
properties.description:
A strong winter storm is expected to move across Eastern Utah and
Western Colorado starting Monday morning and persisting through
Tuesday afternoon. This potent system may bring moderate to heavy
snowfall to most mountain areas with the heaviest accumulations
favored over the eastern Uinta Mountains according to latest
guidance. Peak snowfall rates are expected to occur Monday and
Monday night, which could adversely impact travel.

Some uncertainty remains on the exact track and strength of the
system, but early indications are that a majority of the mountain
passes will be impacted, especially on Monday. In addition to the
heavy snow potential, wind gusts could reach 40 to 50 mph in the
highest elevations of the northern mountains resulting in low
visibility and drifting snow. Anyone planning to travel across
Eastern Utah or Western Colorado early next week should check for
forecast updates on this evolving winter storm.

NWSheadline: STRONG WINTER STORM EXPECTED EARLY NEXT WEEK
